result.execSummary:
The defendant Scotty Wayne Flowers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS, STRAIGHT TIME and Consecutive to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Court ordered defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: Restitution in the amount of $0. Pay DNA surcharges on Count 1, court waived DNA surcharges on Count 2 due to assessing on Count 1. Pay all court costs and all applicable fees of supervision. If defendant is revoked all amounts become due and owing immediately to convert to a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the Probation Department.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.
- 25 hours of community service.
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Seek/maintain full-time employment.
- Anger management classes.
- No violent contact with victim.
- Provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scotty Wayne Flowers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
As to the amended counts:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is ordered by the court to provided a DNA sample.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS straight time at the House of Corrections CONCURRENT with Count 2 
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS straight time at the House of Corrections CONCURRENT with Count 1
These sentences are CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court grants 2 days credit 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 months probation.
   Conditions of Probation:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 25 hours of community service
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment 
- anger management classes
- no violent contact with victim
- no possession of firearms
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges on Count 1;  Court waived DNA surcharges on Count 2 due to assessing DNA surcharges on Count 1
All court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
If defendant is revoked all amounts become due and owing immediateley to convert to a civil judgment.
Appeal rights given

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Scotty Wayne Flowers in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed, second original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to two misdemeanor counts :  Count 1  Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.20(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A and
Count 2:  Disorderly Conduct, Use of a Dangerous Weapon contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1). 939.51(3)(b), 939.63(1)(a), 939.63(1)(1), a Class B misdemeanor
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed

Defendant Scotty Wayne Flowers in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called on status of jury trial.  Both State and defense have witness issues.  Parties meet in chambers.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Prior to the issuance of the bench warrant defendant Scotty Flowers appeared.  The court is informed by Branch 17 that the defendant was in Branch 17 all morning.  Attorney Joseph Kennedy confirms he gave the defendant the wrong courtroom number.    Final pretrial held.   State's final offer is made on the record which is rejected by the defendant.  Case remains set for jury trial on 11/30/2015 at 9:00 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shakeena F

Defendant Scotty Wayne Flowers in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Scotty Wayne Flowers in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
